intro: Lepidiberis polyclada, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, upright stem. Its leaves are usually velvety and dark green, while the flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. Lepidiberis polyclada is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
